div.p: itu vaṉpoṟai (ER, ET, EV: vaṉpuṟai) etiraḻintatu.
This is being desolate in the face of consolation.

lg.l: I won't rememberT.V.G. reads here, with EN and ET: uḷaṉē vāḻi tōḻi "I [still] exist, oh friend." Actually, both variants do not go well with the usual impact of the ūṅku constructions which is that of temporal anteriority. So here we have to understand something like "until" for the whole to make sense., oh friend,
broken inside, with my mind like mire,
